| A chieftain:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is a [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)").
* is normally generated [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |                                                      |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  | [monst.c#line3113](/wiki/Monst.c#line3113 "Monst.c") |

- *For the hero rank, see [Barbarian#Rank titles](/wiki/Barbarian#Rank_titles "Barbarian").*

The **chieftain**, @, is a [Barbarian](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian") [quest guardian](/wiki/Quest_guardian "Quest guardian"). They are not to be confused with the male [barbarian](/wiki/Barbarian_\(player_monster\) "Barbarian (player monster)") [player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster"), which is referred to as a chieftain if generated at the appropriate level for that rank title. Like the [quest leader](/wiki/Quest_leader "Quest leader") [Pelias](/wiki/Pelias "Pelias") and other [barbarians](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian"), they have [intrinsic](/wiki/Intrinsic "Intrinsic") [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance").

## Encyclopedia entry

These strange creatures live mostly on the surface of the earth, gathering together in societies of various forms, but occasionally a stray will descend into the depths and commit mayhem among the dungeon residents who, naturally, often resent the intrusion of such beasts. They are capable of using weapons and magic, and it is even rumored that the Wizard of Yendor is a member of this species.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.4. Click here for more information.](/images/3/37/Nh364-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.4. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.4](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.4 "NetHack 3.6.4"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-364}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Chieftain

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
@ chieftain
Difficulty 7
Attacks Weapon 1d6
@ chieftain
Difficulty 7
Attacks

Weapon 1d6

Base level 5
Base experience 61
Speed 12
Base AC 10
Base MR 10
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size Medium
Resistances Poison
Resistances conveyed None

A chieftain:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is normally generated peaceful.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference monst.c#line3113
For the hero rank, see Barbarian#Rank titles.

The chieftain, @, is a Barbarian quest guardian. They are not to be confused with the male barbarian player monster, which is referred to as a chieftain if generated at the appropriate level for that rank title. Like the quest leader Pelias and other barbarians, they have intrinsic poison resistance.

Encyclopedia entry

These strange creatures live mostly on the surface of the earth, gathering together in societies of various forms, but occasionally a stray will descend into the depths and commit mayhem among the dungeon residents who, naturally, often resent the intrusion of such beasts. They are capable of using weapons and magic, and it is even rumored that the Wizard of Yendor is a member of this species.


This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.6.4. Information on this page may be out of date.

Editors: After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-364}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
